response: the Around the world in 80 Trees book and the tote bag! I have been reading about one tree every breakfast time. The information in the book is much more interesting than I imagined! My favourite tree so far is the Socotra dragon tree.

(extremely) generous birthday money! The money went towards a refurbished second hand DSLR camera.One reason why I have decided to buy this is because i am planning on filming a short film writtenby two of my friends that requires a better sensor and lens to film in low light conditions
the 18 inch frying pan (as well as providing most of the eggs for my second breakfasts). I must have cooked at least 150 eggs in it!
the new chain and sprocket for my bike as well as splitting the camera deposit halfway. It's a shame it was a scam but it's a very important life lesson for me.

the complete Vivaldi Cello Sonatas and the Tony's Chocoloney! I am learning a few pieces from the sonatas at the moment and the new edition is much nicer and easier to read. However, a lot is in tenor clef (but I suppose that's a good thing as it means that it will improve my reading of it)!
the Beef Jerky and Japanese Matcha Tea! The Matcha is really nice and feels very green (no other way to describe it!). I'm sure the Beef Jerky will come in handy on my next hike.
